Articles.Content: Yesterday was the 30th anniversary of the Challenger accident, and NASA had an official Day of Remembrance to honor the Challenger, Columbia, and Apollo 1 crews. They had a moment of silence on the ISS...

The future of mankind belongs to those who wonder what's over the next hill, who take risks, even if they are great, who take the next step for mankind, and who yearn for the human race to become more, if we are not like that, how can we call ourselves human?

Lets remember the crews of Apollo 1, Challenger, and Colombia, and honor them, not just by saying nice words, but by exploring deep space, by climbing over the next hill, and by taking the first step for humanity's expansion into the Cosmo's.﻿

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Nq7f97dtmR4

Edited January 29, 2016 by Spaceception
